channel.title: Tor logs in Whonix discussion
channel.description:
Debian Tor default: ``` Log notice file /var/log/tor/log ```
In Whonix 12 we are currently using: ``` Log notice file /var/log/tor/log Log notice syslog Log notice file /run/tor/log ```
Do we want to log to `syslog`?
Logging to `/var/run/tor/log` is useful for two reasons. It's a shorter Tor log. Only since last reboot. And therefore it's better for [anondate](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/TimeSync#anondate) to parse that one.
Currently all with loglevel `notice`. Example: [1] Currently there are unfortunately many very similar spammy messages. So it's difficult to extract something useful from the log for both users and developers (such as when users post a log or during development).
Quote from Tor manual:
> Recognized severity levels are debug, info, notice, warn, and err. We advise using "notice" in most cases, since anything more verbose may provide sensitive information to an attacker who obtains the logs.
Perhaps it would be useful to have an extra log that only contains messages of severity warn and err? I.e.
``` Log warn file /var/log/tor/log.warn_err ```
-----
[1] This is a typical log in Whonix-Gateway with loglevel `notice`.
``` Apr 22 03:41:47.000 [notice] Tor 0.2.7.6 (git-605ae665009853bd) opening log file. Apr 22 03:41:47.652 [notice] Tor v0.2.7.6 (git-605ae665009853bd) running on Linux with Libevent 2.0.21-stable, OpenSSL 1.0.1k and Zlib 1.2.8. Apr 22 03:41:47.652 [notice] Tor can't help you if you use it wrong! item.title: Tor logs in Whonix discussion
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
HulaHoop:

Do we want to log to syslog?

Probably not. Would not using syslog complicate a potential sdwdate host port?

No, it’s not used for anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Tor logs in Whonix discussion
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Do we want to log to syslog?

Probably not. Would not using syslog complicate a potential sdwdate host port?

Perhaps it would be useful to have an extra log that only contains messages of severity warn and err?

Yes it would make the logs more useful and probably faster to parse.

Read full topic

item.title: Tor logs in Whonix discussion
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Debian Tor default:

Log notice file /var/log/tor/log

In Whonix 12 we are currently using:

Log notice file /var/log/tor/log
Log notice syslog
Log notice file /run/tor/log

Do we want to log to syslog?

Logging to /var/run/tor/log is useful for two reasons. It’s a shorter Tor log. Only since last reboot. And therefore it’s better for anondate to parse that one.

Currently all with loglevel notice. Example: [1] Currently there are unfortunately many very similar spammy messages. So it’s difficult to extract something useful from the log for both users and developers (such as when users post a log or during development).

Quote from Tor manual:

Recognized severity levels are debug, info, notice, warn, and err. We advise using “notice” in most cases, since anything more verbose may provide sensitive information to an attacker who obtains the logs.

Perhaps it would be useful to have an extra log that only contains messages of severity warn and err? I.e.

Log warn file /var/log/tor/log.warn_err

[1] This is a typical log in Whonix-Gateway with loglevel notice.
